DataElement.preferredName: Substance Extraction Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Fasting Flag ISO21090.BL.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed action of extracting something from an associated study subject for the purpose of the extracted product to be administered to a study subject. EXAMPLE(S): A donor giving Bone Marrow Stem Cells for a Stem Cell Transplant NOTE(S): The study subject could be the same for the extraction and the intended administration. This is different than a performed specimen collection, in that the intent is different: This is a donation. Specifies whether the participant had abstained from eating when the specimen is obtained.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Substance Extraction Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Fasting Flag
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.:The act of pulling out, including the process of obtaining something from a mixture or compound by chemical or physical or mechanical means.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._Abstaining from food.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Concepts.definition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.
The act of pulling out, including the process of obtaining something from a mixture or compound by chemical or physical or mechanical means.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Abstaining from food.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

Concepts.definition: An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader
Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
